description: FUGA Wall 4-way Switch with LED + Relay
exclusion:
Follow the inclusion procedures; the device is removed in the same manner, when the controller is in Removing Mode.

Factory reset:
ZHC5010 can be factory reset by pressing the small button in the middle of the module (normally covered by small plastic cover) for at least 10 seconds. Remove the middle plastic cover by means of a small screwdriver, and press the small button for at least 10 seconds, until all the LEDs lights up. Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.
inclusion: Place your primary controller in Adding Mode by following the manufacturer's instructions, then activate the add mode on the device by triple-clicking the upper left button on the module, or by triple-clicking the little button in the middle of the module (hidden behind the small plastic cover). Adding Mode is indicated by blinking of upper left LED until the timeout occurs after 10 seconds or the module has been added in the network.
label: ZHC5010
overview:
ZHC5010 is a wall switch module with Z-Wave communication. The module contains four buttons, four LEDs, a built-in relay switch and is designed to fit into a standard LK FUGA® wall box (one-module format). The ZHC5010 Wall Switch allows you to control the local load as well as Z-Wave connected devices in up to four additional Z-Wave groups.

Configuration updated: 2017-03-12 14:35:03, firmware 1.09

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Upper paddle buttons mode
parameters.description: Configuration of Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2)
parameters.overview:
0: Separate mode (toggle mode)

1: In pair mode, left side sends on/up commands, right side sends off/down commands

parameters.overview: Configuration of Pair Mode for the upper two buttons (button #1 and #2).

parameters.label: Relay mode
parameters.description: How built-in relay is controlled
parameters.overview: This parameter configures which of the buttons that shall control the built-in relay, or if the relay only will be activated for one second, each time button #1 is used.

options.label: Relay is activated for one second, button #1
Relay is activated for half a second, button #2
Relay is activated for half a second, button #3
Relay is activated for half a second, button #4
Relay follows the state of button #1
Relay follows the state of button #2
Relay follows the state of button #3
Relay follows the state of button #4
Relay controlled by cmds sent to the root dev

parameters.label: Indicator mode.
parameters.description: set the current light level for the actual LED or the level value can be stored
parameters.overview: When ZHC5010 receives an Indicator Set message, then the received value can be used only to set the current light level for the actual LED or the level value can be stored and will then be used for subsequent internal activations.

options.label: Indicator Set level used to ctrl LED.
Indicator Set level val and intrnl LED activations

parameters.label: Scene notification offset.
parameters.description: Scene sequence numbers transmitted by Central Scene notifications.
parameters.overview:
Configure the scene sequence numbers that will be transmitted by Central Scene notifications.

Button #1 will send scene [value], button #2 will send scene [value] + 1, button #3 will send scene [value] + 2, button #4 will send scene [value] + 3. (Default = 1)

parameters.label: Disable House Cleaning.
parameters.description: Disable House Cleaning Mode.
parameters.overview: This parameter is able to enable or disable the so-called “House Cleaning Mode”, where ZHC5010 is able send a dimming command in order to set the level of the lights to 100%.
